abs: The multi-objective covariance matrix adaptation evolution strategy (MO-CMA-ES) combines a mutation operator that adapts its search distribution to the underlying optimization problem with multi- criteria selection. Here, a generational and two steady-state selection schemes for the MO-CMA-ES are compared. Further, a recently pro- posed method for computationally ecient adaptation of the search dis- tribution is evaluated in the context of the MO-CMA-ES.
title: Steady-State Selection and Efficient Covariance Matrix Update in the Multi-objective CMA-ES
